page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY 1
page.content: A group of senior citizens were invited to school to discuss village life in the 1920's and 1930's. The village was then made up of a small number of houses around the church.Roads were narrow nd bounded by high Cornish hedges.Passing places had to be made to allow vehicles to pass. Most people worked in agriculture or associated industry.There were blacksmiths,carpenters,tailors,carters etc.Very few had to travel outside of the parish to work. Services.There was no mains water,electricity or refuse collection.For those without their own well,water was fetched in buckets from the 'Shute'- a pipe running from a spring.Lighting was by oil lamp or candle and cooking was done on coal ranges or paraffin stoves.The village had its own refuse tip.
